item.title: xAI’s legal chief steps down after whirlwind year
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Robert Keele said this week that he has stepped down as xAI’s head of legal after just over a year, saying he wants to spend more time with his children. In his announcement, Keele also acknowledged “daylight between our worldviews” with boss Elon Musk, who hasn’t commented on Keele’s exit. “I love my two toddlers […]

item.title: Tesla shuts down Dojo, the AI training supercomputer that Musk said would be key to full self-driving
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The disbanding of Tesla’s Dojo efforts follows the departure of around 20 workers, who left the automaker to start their own AI company dubbed DensityAI focused on data center services for industries.

item.title: Rocket Lab eyes big defense opportunities with new acquisition
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: Rocket Lab is taking the concept of an 'end-to-end' space company to new heights with a forthcoming acquisition.

item.title: High costs and thin margins threatening AI coding startups
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Coding assistant startups are highly unprofitable, says a source familiar with Windsurf financials.

item.title: How to use Instagram Map and set your location-sharing preferences
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Following concerns about safety, Instagram head Adam Mosseri reassured users that the feature is opt-in, and noted that some people are “confused” about how the feature works.

item.title: IPO hopeful Brex scored major win to sell in the EU, plans UK expansion
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The EU has authorized Brex to sell its spend management products directly in all 30 countries, "no workarounds required," CEO Pedro Franceschi said.

item.title: SpaceX is building a water pipeline to Starbase — but access comes with some conditions
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: SpaceX has reportedly distributed an “unconditional and perpetual agreement” to non-SpaceX affiliated homes that would exchange access to Starbase’s water and sewer system for residents’ agreement to leave the area for “any and all launch, testing and other operational activities.”

item.title: OpenAI’s GPT-5 is here
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says GPT-5 is the "best model in the world," and aims to make ChatGPT more intuitive to use.

item.title: AI agents aren’t the ‘new Google,’ says Airbnb CEO
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: AI chatbots, while potentially driving new leads to the travel and services business, aren't entirely a replacement for the referrals that the dominant search engine brings.

item.title: The backlash against Duolingo going ‘AI-first’ didn’t even matter
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Duolingo faced significant backlash for announcing that it would become an "AI-first" company -- and yet, the app posted strong financials this quarter.

item.title: Elon Musk says X plans to introduce ads in Grok’s responses
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The move would help power X's struggling ads business following the departure of former CEO Linda Yaccarino.

item.title: Truth Social’s AI search is powered by Perplexity, but the platform can set limits on sources
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The search engine, dubbed Truth Search AI, is already available on the web version of Truth Social, with public Beta testing on the iOS and Android apps planned for “the near future.”

item.title: Elad Gil — one of tech’s sharpest minds — on early bets, breakout growth, and what’s coming next at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: This October, Gil takes the Disrupt Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 in San Francisco for a fireside chat that promises to cover a lot of ground.

item.title: Data breach at French telecom giant Bouygues affects millions of customers
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: This is the latest cyberattack to hit a French cellular carrier in recent weeks, following an attack on Orange Telecom in July.

item.title: Trump says Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan must ‘resign immediately’
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Trump's post comes after Republican Senator Tom Cotton on Wednesday wrote to Intel's board of directors, asking about Tan's ties to China, his investments in the country, and raised concerns about his time leading Cadence Design Systems, which had a Chinese military university as a customer.

item.title: Library of Congress explains how parts of US Constitution vanished from its website
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis, Zack Whittaker
item.description: The U.S. congressional agency confirmed to TechCrunch that the removal of key sections of the Constitution from its website were removed in error. The full text has now been reinstated.

item.title: Hubble Network plans massive satellite upgrade to create global Bluetooth layer
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: Hubble Network's satellite-enabled Bluetooth network is getting a boost from Muon's new XL satellite bus.

item.title: The Browser Company launches a $20 monthly subscription for its AI-powered browser
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The Browser Company has its first paid plan in the form of $20 per month Dia Pro.

item.title: Two teens charged in attack on former DOGE official Edward ‘Big Balls’ Coristine
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Two 15-year-olds have been charged with unarmed carjacking after allegedly attacking Edward "Big Balls" Coristine, the teenage software engineer and former Neuralink intern who became a prominent figure in the Trump administration's cost-cutting Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).

item.title: Upwork is buying its way into corporate staffing beyond freelancers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: The company will merge Bubty and Ascen with its existing enterprise business to form a separate entity later this year.
